title: Upma
description: Upma, a traditional South Indian breakfast dish, is a delightful blend of semolina, spices, and vegetables. With its unique texture and aromatic flavors, Upma has become a popular choice not only for breakfast but also as a light meal option throughout the day. Whether you're looking for a quick and wholesome breakfast or a comforting dish to satisfy your cravings, Upma offers a fulfilling experience that is both nutritious and delicious.

ingredients.ingredient: fresh coriander leaves, chopped for garnish

instructions.instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan or kadai over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Then add cumin seeds, urad dal, and chana dal. Sauté until the dals turn golden brown.
Add chopped onions, green chili, grated ginger, and curry leaves. Sauté until the onions turn translucent.
Add semolina (rava) to the pan and roast it on medium-low heat for about 5-6 minutes, stirring continuously until it turns aromatic and lightly golden in color.
In a separate saucepan, bring water to a boil.
Slowly pour the boiling water into the roasted semolina, stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming.

Add salt to taste and mix well. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid. Let it cook for about 3-4 minutes or until the semolina absorbs the water and becomes soft and fluffy. Stir occasionally.
If desired, add lemon juice and mix well. This step is optional but adds a tangy flavor to the upma.
Remove the pan from heat and let it rest for a couple of minutes.
Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves.
